questions.question_text:
You are a Dynamics 365 Finance system administrator.
A user is reporting an issue with the Sales Order form. The UI for the form is not loading properly, and there are some performance issues. The object was working fine until the most recent update release. The who personalized the form is using Microsoft Edge. No other users are reporting issues.
You need to resolve the issue.
What should you do?

choices.D: Open the form in a new Microsoft Edge InPrivate session.
choices.A: Reset all the usage data for the user.
choices.C: Reimport and compile the AOT object causing issues.
choices.B: Switch to Microsoft Edge instead of Internet Explorer 11.

discussion.content:
There are several versions of this question in the exam. The question has two possible correct answers:
1. Switch to Microsoft Edge instead of Internet Explorer 11.
2. Reset all the usage data for the user.
Why run Edge in private model is not a choice to determine the issue?
Correct
it is nowhere indicated that the user was working in Internet explorer

questions.question_text:
A company is implementing Dynamics 365 Finance.
You plan to use Task Recorder to document the process of adding a new customer to the system. Before assigning a credit limit to the customer record, the customer's credit must be checked in an external system.
You need to include the credit check in the task recording.
What should you create?

discussion.content: The Add info step gesture lets you insert a step and supply your own text for it. This feature is useful primarily for creating task guides, where a user performs a task outside client. For example, a scenario might require the user to search for item inventory or check an email for information.

Selected Answer: D
Correct

Selected Answer: D
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/user-interface/task-recorder?toc=%2Fdynamics365%2Fsupply-chain%2Ftoc.json#add-info-step

Correct,
Question #41 on 5 page is the same and has wrong answer.
Correct answer

Selected Answer: B
Here the question about tool without Developer help. SysTest is impossible to use without help of Developer. Hence B is correct
Should it not be A (Yes) because SysTest framework is used for regression testing?

comments.content: SysTest framework without developers help? I cannot imagine it :)

questions.question_text:
Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution that might meet the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.
After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.
A company's Dynamics 365 Commerce production instance is updated monthly as new versions of the software are released.
The company needs to identify any potential issues in new releases. They do not have developers to help with this initiative.
You need to implement a way to regression test scenarios.
Solution: Use the SysTest framework to create unit tests for critical business processes.
Does the solution meet the goal?

Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution that might meet the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.
After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.
A company's Dynamics 365 Commerce production instance is updated monthly as new versions of the software are released.
The company needs to identify any potential issues in new releases. They do not have developers to help with this initiative.
You need to implement a way to regression test scenarios.
Solution: Use the Acceptance Test Library (ATL) framework to create regression test scenarios for critical business processes that do not require any X++ code changes.
Does the solution meet the goal?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
ATL is source-code intensive and the question says that the company has no devs.

questions.question_text:
Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution that might meet the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.
After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.
A company's Dynamics 365 Commerce production instance is updated monthly as new versions of the software are released.
The company needs to identify any potential issues in new releases. They do not have developers to help with this initiative.
You need to implement a way to regression test scenarios.
Solution: Place data packages that are related to data task automation in the individual Dynamics Lifecycle Services (LCS) asset library.
Does the solution meet the goal?

comments.content:
I agree.

Data task automation perfoms integration test, not regression test

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/perf-test/rsat/rsat-overview

discussion.content:
incorrect. Should be B
The correct answer is here in another question of this series 
https://www.examtopics.com/discussions/microsoft/view/55436-exam-mb-300-topic-5-question-40-discussion/

Selected Answer: B
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/commerce/dev-itpro/pos-rsat

Selected Answer: A
Both, the RSAT and DTA are correct answers to this question series. The question talks about D365 Commerce being updated monthly (not the Finance and Supply chain). So, it somehow points to integration scenarios where DTA can be used.

This is a bit tricky, since both the RSAT and Data Task Automation can be right answers. Take a note that question talks about D365 Commerce being updated monthly (not the Finance or Supply chain). So, it is somehow pointing to integration scenario where the DTA is a tool that can be used.

While RSAT would be a correct answer, I think that Data Task Automation could also be an acceptable answer because: "You can also create automated testing of data entities by using task outcome validation."

Selected Answer: B
see topic-5-question-40

A is the correct answer if using data task automation as stated in the question. From the link "The data files must be either in the LCS asset library of your LCS project or in the Shared asset library."
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/data-entities/data-task-automation
RSAT is the correct answer
It should be B (No).
